channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Van fly tipping into a neighbours skip, 9th January
item.description:
This van has spent the last hour emptying an entire load of waste into my neighbours skip. Three men who got fairly verbally aggressive with other members of the public when questioned about what they were doing.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Greenvale Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pedestrian crossing “wait” button not working at Great Dover Street (by the Roebuck pub). Location (what3words): ///rate.loss.soccer, 9th January
item.description:
T the pedestrian crossing on Great Dover Street next to the Roebuck pub (what3words: ///rate.loss.soccer), the pedestrian push button / “WAIT” button appears to be faulty. Pressing the button doesn’t register (no response such as the usual confirmation light or beep), and it doesn’t seem to trigger a pedestrian crossing phase. This means pedestrians may wait unnecessarily or be tempted to cross without a safe signal, increasing the risk of accidents. Please inspect the unit and repair/replace the button mechanism as soon as possible.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 165, Great Dover Street, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Raised pavement reference 850 1702, 9th January
item.description:
This issue was previously reported under 8501702 and was deemed not within council guidelines for action. See attached photographs. However, a council employee visited the area on the 8/1/26 carrying out usual six monthly checks. Separately, he has highlighted this as a potential issue in view of the school? I asked about the residents as well? However, independently he marked the pavement for works and advised this would be fixed to avoid any potential come back to the council in view of the school. I advised that I have previously reported. Due to the persistent rain overnight the markings have removed. Please ensure that this pavement is included in the works that are being carried out in the area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Witham Road, Anerley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti in stairwell, 9th January
item.description:
Same perpetrator who has been writing intimidating Christian religious graffiti, and misogynist graffiti in this block for a number of year. Please remove ASAP

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dalwood Street, Peckham, Greater London

This footpath has being un even since August 2025 and it's now getting causing a hazard for push chairs and old people especially in the dark

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): De Frene Road, Perry Vale, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lights out in Bermondsey Street tunnel (under London Bridge Station) – dark section creating safety risk., 9th January
item.description:
In the Bermondsey Street tunnel under London Bridge Station (what3words: ///roofs.export.linen), a significant number of the tunnel lights are not working – roughly 50% appear to be out. This results in uneven lighting along the tunnel, with a particularly dark section in the middle where visibility drops noticeably. The poor lighting reduces sightlines and makes it harder for pedestrians and cyclists to see and be seen, especially when approaching from either end. It increases the risk of trips/collisions and creates blind spots that can allow people to remain concealed, which raises personal safety concerns. Please arrange an inspection and repair of the tunnel lighting as a priority.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33a, Bermondsey Street, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: All out - three or more street lights in a row

item.title: Continuous anti-social behaviour despite previous reports, 9th January
item.description:
Despite multiple reports from myself and concerned neighbours, flat 11 continues to litter, throwing a range of objects out of their window on an almost daily basis. I have seen rats around the food that has been thrown onto the grass.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Whiston Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Progressive road cracking Warwick Road, 9th January
item.description:
Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to report a deteriorating section of road directly outside my property which appears to be showing signs of progressive cracking and possible subsidence. I have monitored the area over the past two weeks and the cracks have significantly widened and extended during this time. I have attached images taken two weeks apart which clearly demonstrate the progression. My concerns are: - Structural weakening of the road surface - Potential subsidence beneath the tarmac - Water ingress into the cracks, accelerating deterioration - Increased risk of potholes forming - Safety risks to pedestrians, cyclists and vehicles - Possible impact on nearby property foundations Given the visible progression, I kindly request that this section of road is urgently inspected by your highways team, with particular attention to: - Ground stability - Drainage beneath the surface - Risk of further collapse Please could you confirm: - When an inspection can be arranged - Whether any temporary safety measures will be put in place - The expected timescale for remedial works I would appreciate this being treated as a priority due to the rapid deterioration and safety implications. Thank you for your assistance and I look forward to your response.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Warwick Road, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wall damaged, 9th January

item.description:
